attributes.action: address the lack of telephone etiquette amongst the banking community and abandon overseas collections centres
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The use of overseas collections centres is reaking havoc to my home - they telephone late at night and persistently. Does the UK govt have a policy on it ? I have absolutely no intention on telling my confidential financial data to :
 
a) a non - UK citizen
b) Someone I don't understand
c) Over the telephone
d) Anyone who won't give me their surname

We are the world's 4th richest country -why are we relying on overseas banking ? Have you ever been in an Indian bank ? The supervision of immigrant staff in all walks of British life is atrocious. Are we really recruiting more ? The petitioner is calling on Alistair Darling to look at this please for public sector workers as well as timesheet signing and salary payment. When I am working shifts, this is really unacceptable.

reasons: Wording that needs to be amended, or is impossible to understand
Statements that don't actually request any action
Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
